title: Grades 6-8: American Sign Language, Level IV
subject: Languages Other Than English (2014-)

document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Languages Other Than English

44FCD6C7F5AE433CA41D6E27201E88A5.description: show evidence of becoming a lifelong learner by using ASL at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level for personal enrichment and career development.

DBA5F95E494A4C6185356946AAC91750.description: use technology to communicate with the Deaf/ASL community; and

F1689C6A1B9A4FFC890F058AD94C1BA7.description: apply ASL at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level in or out of the school setting through involvement in cultural activities such as attending Deaf events;

1A0041B439814BED98C93A40AC7D1C4A.description: Communities. The student participates in the Deaf/ASL community by using ASL. The student is expected to:

94766A5BDAAC48D98F8D52B8430FAF06.description: apply ASL at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level to demonstrate an understanding of how one language and culture can influence another.

E6F163F2740944F88733B07D114055A8.description: apply ASL at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level to demonstrate an understanding of the nature of culture through comparisons of the student's own culture and the American Deaf culture; and

8F4F43ECF93F4F49B226B27B20FC8377.description: apply ASL at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level to demonstrate an understanding of the nature of language through comparisons of the student's own language and ASL;

7CC68E2280414E9EB1BB9776A8D0BC6A.description: Comparisons. The student expands insight into the nature of language and culture by comparing the student's own language and culture to ASL and American Deaf culture. The student is expected to:

295B4C6C528A4E03995DB25F4F7836A1.description: apply ASL at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level to obtain, reinforce, or expand knowledge of other subject areas.

58721B43DA1044BD931C2FC858E30E28.description: use resources and digital technology to gain access to extensive information on ASL and Deaf culture; and

1E5A38F2D93942E8A1351B80B33A684D.description: Connections. The student uses ASL to make connections with other subject areas and to acquire information. The student is expected to:

D7BBC38AC8E14F9A87FCE011D21C8755.description: demonstrate an in-depth understanding of Deaf history and how it applies to the perspectives of American Deaf culture.

2984ABD313EC434DBC2B2C7551132DF6.description: apply ASL to show evidence of appreciation of the contributions to arts and sciences by the Deaf and how they are applied to the perspectives of American Deaf culture; and

CA225A01AE8C4A6497C86940892B0593.description: apply ASL to show evidence of appreciation of ASL literature created by the Deaf and how it applies to the perspectives of American Deaf culture;

AD623474B57342ABB46A5B05ACC4F942.description: apply ASL to recognize and use Deaf cultural norms to demonstrate an understanding of the perspectives of American Deaf culture;

DE6EF2D614064FDE88B61F34BEF61F53.description: Cultures. The student gains knowledge and understanding of American Deaf culture. The student is expected to:

6521A28699D64953993712B6A1641D20.description: create and express ASL literature, including handshape stories, that follows traditional cultural features.

09A0140CAA7C4965A16D366DCD7E70DA.description: demonstrate appropriate usage of ASL phonology, morphology, syntax, semantics, and pragmatics at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level; and

40C48FF49E8E4B639EEB6F5EAC7BD0E0.description: convey information in ASL using concepts, classifiers, phrases, and sentences to others without voice at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level;

49DC75C509D240148295ED72F36F85B3.description: demonstrate an understanding of ASL such as stories, commands, and instructions when dealing with familiar and unfamiliar topics;

DDC4FF2BA38D43E6841745C54206A76B.description: engage in a variety of ASL exchanges of learned material to socialize and to provide and obtain information at an intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level;

44B565B960C945B5A98F13EBDDFD417A.description: Communication. The student communicates in ASL using expressive and receptive communication skills without voice. The student is expected to:
